article.headline: Wright St 61, Butler 66
article.story: DAYTON, Ohio (AP) -- Zach Williams scored 21 points and sparked a second-half rally to lead Wright State to a 61-55 victory over Butler on Monday night. DaShaun Wood added 15 points and Zakee Boyd had 10 for the Raiders (11-12, 6-6 Horizon League). Brandon Polk scored 22 points for Butler (9-12, 4-7). Brandon Crone added 14. After shooting just 37 percent from the field in the first half, which left the score tied at 25 at halftime, Wright State shot 59 percent in the second half. There were seven ties and three lead changes in the second half, and the Raiders needed a short jumper by Williams with 45 seconds left to go ahead for good. Boyd hit all four free throws after that. Butler was 9-of-10 at the line, while Wright State hit 14-of-18.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
